description:
The nova-manage vpn commands are broken, because they have a call to db.instance_get_all() without supplying a context.  This results in the command getting started with its output, but then saying "Wrong number of arguments supplied":

xenapi $ bin/nova-manage vpn list
project         ip:port                 state
user            10.0.0.1:1000      Wrong number of arguments supplied
vpn list: Print a listing of the VPNs for all projects.

This is because nova-manage is wrapped in an except block that rather horribly treats all TypeErrors as if the user has supplied the wrong arguments.
title: nova-manage vpn commands broken, resulting in erroneous 'Wrong number of arguments supplied' message

user            10.0.0.1:1000      Wrong number of arguments supplied

This is because nova-manage is wrapped in an except block that rather horribly treats all TypeErrors as if the user has supplied the wrong arguments.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ewanmellor
